intro: Cicerbita zhenduoi, commonly known as the Zhenduoi bittercress, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, alternate leaves, and small white or yellow flowers. It produces small, round seeds that are often dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
